meanings.definition: Covering with or as if with a veil.
meanings.sent1: She was veiling her emotions to hide her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The fog was veiling the mountain, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The magician was veiling his tricks to keep the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: The darkness veiling the night sky added an air of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The artist was veiling the unfinished painting until the big reveal.

meanings.sent1: The veiling mist made the forest seem enchanted.
meanings.sent2: Her veiling smile hinted at a hidden agenda.
meanings.sent3: The veiling clouds played a game of hide and seek with the sun.
meanings.sent4: The veiling curtain added an element of surprise to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The veiling cloak of secrecy shrouded the truth in mystery.

meanings.definition: A piece of cloth worn to cover the head and face.
meanings.sent1: She wore a veiling over her head during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The bride's veiling was delicate and intricate.
meanings.sent3: The veiling fluttered in the breeze as she walked.
meanings.sent4: The veiling shielded her from the harsh sun rays.
meanings.sent5: The veiling added an air of elegance to her outfit.
